entry.title: Thanksgiving Celebration Insights.
entry.summary:
Exploring the tendencies in Celebrating Thanksgiving.¶

In this project we are going to explore the tendencies that people follow in this celebration.¶

First, we are going to check what dishes and desserts are the favourites among people.¶

Secondly, we are going to get the income and see how it is correlated from How far people travel to celebrate Thnksgiving.¶

<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Exploring-the-tendencies-in-Celebrating-Thanksgiving.">Exploring the tendencies in Celebrating Thanksgiving.<a class="anchor-link" href="#Exploring-the-tendencies-in-Celebrating-Thanksgiving.">¶</a></h1><h3 id="In-this-project-we-are-going-to-explore-the-tendencies-that-people-follow-in-this-celebration.">In this project we are going to explore the tendencies that people follow in this celebration.<a class="anchor-link" href="#In-this-project-we-are-going-to-explore-the-tendencies-that-people-follow-in-this-celebration.">¶</a></h3><h4 id="First,-we-are-going-to-check-what-dishes-and-desserts-are-the-favourites-among-people.">First, we are going to check what dishes and desserts are the favourites among people.<a class="anchor-link" href="#First,-we-are-going-to-check-what-dishes-and-desserts-are-the-favourites-among-people.">¶</a></h4><h4 id="Secondly,-we-are-going-to-get-the-income-and-see-how-it-is-correlated-from-How-far-people-travel-to-celebrate-Thnksgiving.">Secondly, we are going to get the income and see how it is correlated from How far people travel to celebrate Thnksgiving.<a class="anchor-link" href="#Secondly,-we-are-going-to-get-the-income-and-see-how-it-is-correlated-from-How-far-people-travel-to-celebrate-Thnksgiving.">¶</a></h4><h4 id="Finally,-we-are-going-to-conclude-our-project-Linking-celebration-and-friends-and-observing-what-age-range-tends-to-celebrate-most-Thanksgiving.">Finally, we are going to conclude our project Linking celebration and friends and observing what age range tends to celebrate most Thanksgiving.<a class="anchor-link" href="#Finally,-we-are-going-to-conclude-our-project-Linking-celebration-and-friends-and-observing-what-age-range-tends-to-celebrate-most-Thanksgiving.">¶</a></h4>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<span class="n">dataset</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">)</span>

<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="2)-Exploring-Main-dishes-people-tend-to-eat-during-Thanksgiving-dinner">2) Exploring Main dishes people tend to eat during Thanksgiving dinner<a class="anchor-link" href="#2)-Exploring-Main-dishes-people-tend-to-eat-during-Thanksgiving-dinner">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [15]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">thanks_dishes_count</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'What is typically the main dish at your Thanksgiving dinner?'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">value_counts</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'         Main Dish </span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">thanks_dishes_count</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">tofurkey_dish</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'What is typically the main dish at your Thanksgiving dinner?'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'Tofurkey'</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">tofurkey_have_gravy</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">tofurkey_dish</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Do you typically have gravy?'</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tofurkey_have_gravy</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<h3 id="3)-Let's-see-what-pies-people-eat">3) Let's see what pies people eat<a class="anchor-link" href="#3)-Let's-see-what-pies-people-eat">¶</a></h3>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">apple_isnull</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Which type of pie is typically served at your Thanksgiving dinner? Please select all that apply. - Apple'</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">pumpkin_isnull</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Which type of pie is typically served at your Thanksgiving dinner? Please select all that apply. - Pumpkin'</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">pecan_isnull</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Which type of pie is typically served at your Thanksgiving dinner? Please select all that apply. - Pecan'</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="n">ate_pies</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">apple_isnull</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="n">pumpkin_isnull</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="n">pecan_isnull</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ate_pies</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">value_counts</span><span class="p">())</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>

True     182
dtype: int64
</pre>

<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="4)-Converting-Age-to-Numeric">4) Converting Age to Numeric<a class="anchor-link" href="#4)-Converting-Age-to-Numeric">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [17]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">ext_age</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">age</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">age</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">None</span>
    
    <span class="n">age_split</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">age</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">split</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">' '</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">age_splited</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">age_split</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'+'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">age_splited</span><span class="p">)</span>
        
<span class="n">example</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ext_age</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Age'</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="mi">14</span><span class="p">])</span>  

<span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'int_age'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Age'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ext_age</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'int_age'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">describe</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[17]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>count    1025.000000
mean       39.383415
std        15.398493
min        18.000000
25%        30.000000
50%        45.000000
75%        60.000000
max        60.000000
Name: int_age, dtype: float64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h6 id="Results:">Results:<a class="anchor-link" href="#Results:">¶</a></h6><ul>
<li>As we can observe, with the describe method we have some measurements on the ages we are working with.</li>
<li>We have to be aware that the ages are not exact, because our original data contains a range and we are taking the lowest age in that range. Not true ages but quitte accurate according to the data we are working with.</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [18]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Age'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">value_counts</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>

</div>

<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>45 - 59    286
60+        264
30 - 44    259
18 - 29    216
Name: Age, dtype: int64</pre>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">

<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="5)-Converting-Income-to-Numeric">5) Converting Income to Numeric<a class="anchor-link" href="#5)-Converting-Income-to-Numeric">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [19]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'How much total combined money did all members of your HOUSEHOLD earn last year?'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">value_counts</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="c1">#Function to convert income_string to a data value.</span>
<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">ext_income</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">income</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">income</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">None</span>
    
    <span class="n">income_split</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">income</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">split</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">' '</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">income_split</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'Prefer'</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">None</span>
    <span class="n">income_splitted</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">income_split</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"$"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">","</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">income_splitted</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">example1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'How much total combined money did all members of your HOUSEHOLD earn last year?'</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">split</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">' '</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'int_income'</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'How much total combined money did all members of your HOUSEHOLD earn last year?'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ext_income</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'int_income'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">describe</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[19]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>count       889.000000
mean      74077.615298
std       59360.742902
min           0.000000
25%       25000.000000
50%       50000.000000
75%      100000.000000
max      200000.000000
Name: int_income, dtype: float64</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h6 id="Results:">Results:<a class="anchor-link" href="#Results:">¶</a></h6><p>WE should be aware that we have a range of salary but we are only using the lowest value in each range.</p>
<p>We can se that the mean salary is pretty high. We have also a large standard deviation.</p>
</div>

<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h4 id="Results:">Results:<a class="anchor-link" href="#Results:">¶</a></h4><ul>
<li><p>People with incomes lower than 150000 is more used to celebrate thankgiing at home and less used to go out of town and far away.</p>
</li>
<li><p>People with high incomes (>150000) Celebrates it at home as well.</p>
</li>
<li><p>One interesting data is that people with income lower than 150000 is more used to go out of town but not far away than people with high income, it can be because most of them live out of their family town and they have to move to visit them.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>

        "        preview: 'TeX'," +
        "    }, " +
        "    'HTML-CSS': { " +
        " linebreaks: { automatic: true, width: '95% container' }, " +
        "        styles: { '.MathJax_Display, .MathJax .mo, .MathJax .mi, .MathJax .mn': {color: 'black ! important'} }" +
        "    } " +
        "}); ";
    (document.body || document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0]).appendChild(mathjaxscript);
}
</script>
